preface.para: Fyvrianism is the magic of the earth, of green and growing, of pale and dying things, of the cycles of growth and decay that underlie the natural world. The base of Fyvria is fertile earth, where life swarms in its endless struggle to survive and prosper.

description.para: Greatly accelerates the normal growth of a living plant, causing it to undergo a month of growth over the course of the day. Food and water requirement for the plant are increased by a similar amount.

spell.name: Putrid Hand
spell.boost: +40 Decay speed is a month per minute

description.para: Causes dead organic matter up to size five to begin rotting at a greatly accelerated rate. While the spell is in effect, the material will undergo a days worth of decay each minute. Undead corpses get a will roll to resist the spell, but are otherwise still affected.

spell.name: Figure of Aestras
spell.boost: +40 All plants in range can be affected

description.para: Cause a single plant to grow in a chosen configuration. The magic lasts for the lifetime of the plant, gradually shaping it into its desired form.

spell.name: Balm of Gresan
spell.boost: +40 Allows a second first aid roll

description.para: When cast on an injured target, gives +3 to the first aid roll. Does not grant a second first aid roll for the target if one has previously been made.
Preserves dead organic matter of up to size 6, preventing further decay for about a week. The spell changes the organic matter in order to slow decay.
Causes a wart, boil or similar mark to appear at the point touched on the target person or animal.
Causes a day's growth of hair on the target for each minute the spell is concentrated on. Facial, body and head hair will all grow, though hair will only grow where it would normally.
Causes the subject touched to become relaxed and drowsy. If they are already in a relaxed, drowsy state, then they will fall into a light sleep. Someone who is already asleep will be harder to wake.

spell.name: Image of the Beast
spell.boost: +20 Minimum amount of sample is half a finger

description.para: If part of a creature or person is held, such as a claw or tuft of hair, then an image of that person or creature can be seen. The body part must not have been seperated from the living creature for more than a week. There must be a sizable sample as well, as much as a finger in size.

spell.name: Growth of the Creeping Things
spell.boost: +20 Creatures grow to four times size
+40 Affects up to a dozen creatures

description.para: Causes a single touched creature of size 0 to grow to twice it's normal size. The creature remains at this size while the spell is concentrated on. No version of this spell will cause a creature to grow larger than size 0, however.
Slays a single creature of size 0 unless the spell is resisted.
Causes a strong vine to grow from fertile soil over a period of a minute, growing to a length of 10m. The vine is sturdy enough to support the weight of two people.

spell.name: Meldor's Entanglement
spell.boost: +15 Can specify which people are grabbed.

description.para: Causes living plants in the area of effect to grab at, and wrap themselves around people nearest to them. It requires a strength roll of 20+ to move each round.

Prevents a touched wound from becoming infected. It stops bleeding and any potential worsening of the wound. If the wound is already infected, then it has no effect. Can be considered similar to a first aid attempt on the wound, though there is no chance of healing a body level. Note that the magic only seals and cleans the wound and does not have any long term effect beyond this. If the wound is reopened it may possibly be infected, though it is unlikely.

Causes a single open wound to become infected. If the spell is not resisted, then the target must make a stamina roll each day at difficulty 20, modified by normal wound penalty. Failure means the wound worsens by one level. The wound remains infected until the target dies, or the wound is purged of theinfection.
This spell causes the skin and flesh on a living target to be bruised and crushed, causing one level of stun damage if the target fails to resist.

spell.name: Crushing the Swarm
spell.boost: +15 Spell may affect only a specified type of creature
+30 Spell may target an individual group

description.para: Slays all size zero creatures within range. Death is immediate. Versions of this spell to increase its range have been attempted, but so far none have been possible with increasing the rank of the spell. Creatures of all types are slain, and the basic spell does not allow some types to be ignored.
Slay a single creature within range of the spell up to size one. Creatures of larger size are totally unaffected by the spell.

Causes plant life within reach of the caster to wither and die. As the caster moves, he will leave an ashen path around him which is very easy to follow. However, it makes walking through thick forests much easier. As long as the caster moves at no greater than walking speed, then foliage ahead of him will wither and give way in time for him to move through. The Sindarin hate his spell, since it causes so much damage.

An enchantment which causes a single item of wood to expand, primarily across the grain. The effect is most dramatic with green or living wood. Seasoned wood expands by 15%, green wood by 30% and living wood by 60%. The wood is generally weakened by the change. A target up to size 12 can be affected.

A spell to increase the healing rate of a wound suffered by a living creature. They get a +12 bonus for their next natural healing roll. Only one casting of this spell will work on a target at any one time.

A spell to temporarily increase one of the caster's physical attributes (strength, stamina, agility or dexterity) by one point. It cannot be combined with any other attribute enhancing spell (including itself, even if different spells are affecting different attributes).

Causes a single living creature to fall into a deep slumber. Each night they sleep, they get one natural healing roll (instead of getting one at the end of each week). The creature will naturally awaken the morning after they become fully healed. This spell can be combined with spells such as Nurture of Isla.

spell.name: Mankor's Curse
spell.boost: +60 Affects all designated creatures in near of target

description.para: A spell to induce a unique wasting disease in a single creature. The victim suffers -10 to all healing (including first aid) and fatigue recovery rolls (including sleep). If cast multiple times on a target, then only the worst effect applies.

spell.name: Eye of Perfection
spell.boost: +30 Know all things about the target

description.para: Analyses the health of a single living creature, informing the caster of the nature of the worst injury the target is suffering from.
Causes a single target up to size 6 to fall asleep if they fail their stamina resistance roll. Higher castings of this spell may affect multiple targets up to the total size that may be affected.

Transfers a disease, infection or other natural ailment (not a wound) from one living creature to another living creature. Both make stamina rolls to resist, and the spell fails unless they are both failed. Neither creature can be greater than size 6.
This spell causes the skin and flesh on a living target to rupture, causing one body level of damage if the target fails to resist.

Regenesis greatly accelerates the healing of living things. While the spell is being maintained, the target creature will get a natural healing roll every eight hours. The Shek-Pvar must keep the spell up over at least an eight hour period while her target rests or sleeps. The process is fatiguing however, five fatigue levels are gained by the target during the period, reduced by one per point of stamina. Versions of this spell which regenerate limbs do so very slowly. Even a lost hand will take about 15 days. Dead matter, even if it can be regenerated, can never be restored to life.

spell.name: Vine of Alguinas
spell.boost: +15 Centre of affect can be up to range near
+30 Can be cast on thorny/non-succulent plants

description.para: This spells causes very rapid growth in succulent vines. All plants within range begin growing to form a clump of tough, tangled vines, branches and roots. After three rounds, when the plants have reached about ten times normal size, they will die. The plants will have rotted back within about half an hour. Though the Shek-Pvar is at the centre of the area when it begins to grow, he generally does have time to get clear if he so wishes. Anyone caught in the vines needs to make a strength roll of 30+ each round to try and escape. Even success means they move only 1m.

spell.name: Animus of Nithri
spell.boost: +20 If the zombie has muscles, it can be commanded to move, though control is literal and very difficult
+40 Zombie can be given simple directions
+80 Zombie can be given tasks, such as to fight or follow

description.para: Animus of Nithri restores a small portion of a dead creature's animus, effectively creating a zombie. It cannot be used on a creature who has had buriel rites performed on it, since it requires a portion of the dead creature's soul to be present in the corpse. The basic spell is enough to activate the memories and (if they are still functional) vocal cords of the dead creature. Memories decay with time. Intelligence and will both drop by a point after a day, a week, and then each month after that, down to a minimum of one.

spell.name: Regrowth of Evala
spell.boost: +20 Only 25% of the original is required
+40 Only 10% of the original is required
+80 Only 5% of the original is required

description.para: This spell regrows a complete organism from a part of it. For the basic spell, 50% of the organism must be present in order to regrow the whole. It can be used to regrow lost body parts, restore corpses or recover a plant. Dead organisms are not restored to life.

spell.name: Silme's Ward
spell.boost: +20 Caster is alerted as to general nature of intruder
+40 Specific information about intruders are known, limited by sense of the target
+80 Caster may limit what type of intruders raise an alarm

description.para: When cast upon a living plant or creature, the Shek-Pvar will be alerted if the target perceives another living creature. It is generally used as a alarm. The Shek'Pvar must be within medium range of the target if she is to hear the alarm. The perceptive range of most plants is about three metres. The warning is via a mind link to the Shek-Pvar.

This spell will heal either disease or injury in a living creature. If used to heal a disease, then the disease is completely healed, and the creature gains from one to five points of long term fatigue, depending on the severity of the disease. If used to heal injuries, then up to six body levels are immediately healed, and converted to long term fatigue. If the target cannot gain more fatigue, then there is no effect. It cannot be used to regenerate lost body parts.

spell.name: Passage of Chabar
spell.boost: +40 Organic clothing and equipment is affected

description.para: This spell enables the caster to melt through earth, stone or wood, though not other substances. The caster can move through earth at one quarter walking speed, through wood at a fifth speed, and through stone at one tenth speed. If the caster is inside a solid object when the spell stops, then she is instantly killed. Clothes and equipment are unaffected, so only her naked body can travel this way.

This spell grows an adult body from a dead embryo or foetus, though it only works on mammals. The foetus must have been dead at least six hours, and no more than 24 hours when the spell is begun. It takes about ten hours of casting initially to start the spell, and the foetus must be kept in clean water and finely sifted earth. Each day, the growing body consumes about 200 litres of water and 100kg of earth, and the caster must spend about 4 hours with the body. After 56 days, the body is a fully grown adult, and is ready to receive a spirit. It will die within a few hours if a spirit does not inhabit it.

This spell halts all biological aging in the Shek-Pvar. It requires a transfusion of one litre of blood from a Sindarin or other immortal species. The caster will stop aging for 1 year. However, one point of stamina and strength is lost permanently.

spell.name: Touch of Ptaris
spell.boost: +50 Final form can be wood or earth. Earth tends to crumble, so is usually fatal

description.para: This spell turns an organic target up to size 12 to stone. The target is still capable of thought, though at greatly reduced rate.
